g.text: START
input
Variable["inventory.hjelm_firsthub_reached"]
Logic: Considering the sheer amount of different Hjelmdallermann books out there it's very unlikely you're ever gonna find the sequel.
Jump to: [Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: "The Man from Hjelmdall stares at yo..."]
Logic: Considering the sheer amount of different Hjelmdallermann books out there it's very unlikely you're ever gonna find the sequel.

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: In the first scene the Man from Hjelmdall fought a powerful necromancer and his army of the dead. Now he's confronting a pair of Nachtherrer and their horde of orkenoid thralls. The two couldn't be further apart.
You: Nah, that's just too silly for my taste. (Close the book.)
You: Okay, fine. What happens next?
Variable["inventory.hjelm_concept_inside"]
Variable["inventory.hjelm_concept_inside"]
!(Variable["inventory.hjelm_concept_inside"])
Physical Instrument: Hey! Nothing wrong with muscle and bone.
You: Okay, but does he have any *internal* tension?
Exactly. Where's the tension *inside* him?
You: Nevermind, just get to the good part.
Muscle and blood is all I need. Let's get back to that.
Jump to: [Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: "You skip past a section detailing a..."]

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: You skip past a section detailing an elaborate banquet with *many* toasts, as well as the long and perilous journey from Wrôthgär's keep to the ancient forest of *Yezzdor*, where our heroes infiltrate the Nachtherrer's dire-hall...
You: Look at the back cover.

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: The back blurb reads: "His latest adventure serves as the perfect introduction to the savage *Hjelmdall Saga*! Meet Man from Hjelmdall, his faithful blood-brother Tyrbald, the noble Lord Wrôthgär, and some of their most fearsome foes yet. For the Northlands! For HJELMDALL!"
Jump to: [Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: "The Man from Hjelmdall stares at yo..."]
Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: The Man from Hjelmdall stares at you on the cover, his face fixed in grim resolve.
Half Light: These images speak to something burbling deep within you: The primal struggle of a bunch of violent apes just dukin' it out.
hjelmbookhub
Half Light: That is what you came for, isn't it? A climactic bloodletting, where men are reduced to muscle and fury?
Variable["doomed.bookstore_hjelmdallerman_halfligt_muscle_and_fury"]

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: A few chapters later the Man from Hjelmdall and Tyrbald are in a completely different setting, high above an arid desert, riding a pair of gryffins that always seem to appear at narratively convenient moments...
Conceptualization: This book makes a mockery of the very idea of good plotting, though something tells you coherence was never the point.

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: He is the Man from Hjelmdall! Forged in the fury of battle, death was his sire and blood his dam. He had but fourteen winters when he left his frigid homelands in Katla to seek glory and honour. *That* is his character.
Conceptualization: He doesn't even have a real name. What is inside this Man? Or is muscle and bone all he is?
Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: He is the wildest man alive, the only mortal strong enough to wield the twin-*zweihänders*, *Sturm* and *Drang*, whose names mean 'Storm' and --

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: In the centre of the great hall stands a blood altar on which a pair of Nachtherrer are disembowelling a shrieking peasant -- an unholy rite that empowers the Nachtherrer forbidden magic...
You: Wow... they're in trouble now.

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: "*Nein*, Tyrbald!" the Man from Hjelmdall bellows over the army of flesh and bone. "Have courage! For the Northlands... for HJELMDALL!!!" He leaps to the mezzanine to face the black-eyed figure and like a mad ice bear whirling twin *zweihänders* -- *Sturm* and *Drang* -- he ploughs through the ranks of the deathless, surrounding the necromancer...
Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: The Man from Hjelmdall stares out at you from the cover, his face fixed in grim resolve.
Jump to: [Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: "You skip past a section detailing a..."]

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: By nightfall only the Man from Hjelmdall and his blood-brother, noble Tyrbald are left standing against the dead horde. "It is an honour to die by your side, brother!" Tyrbald cries as his battle-axe beheads one of their reanimated comrades.
You: I'm too old for this...
You: All aboard for slaughter and glory. (Keep reading.)
Hand/Eye Coordination: The writer has *never* held a sword in their life, let alone two two-handed swords at the same time.
Logic: It is physically impossible for a human being to effectively dual-wield *zweihänder* swords in any kind of real-life combat situation.
Logic: Considering the sheer amount of different Hjelmdallermann books out there it's very unlikely you're ever gonna find the sequel.
Jump to: [Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: "The Man from Hjelmdall stares at yo..."]

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: The cover of this tattered paperback features the Man from Hjelmdall standing atop a pile of bloody corpses. His two zweihänders are crossed over his massive chest in a dramatic 'x', their blades dripping with gore...
You: Hell yeah.
You: Seems... over the top?
You: Skip ahead.
You: Hold on, why is the Man from Hjelmdall doing any of this?
Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: What do you mean?
You: Yes, I get that. He's strong and has big swords. But why should I *care* about his character?
You: I don't need sass from a discount paperback. (Close the book.)
Jump to: [Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: "The Man from Hjelmdall stares at yo..."]

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: When the din of battle settles, only the Man from Hjelmdall and Tyrbald remain standing. Exhausted and dripping with the entrails of their foes, the two northmen confront the foul Nachtherrer. The Man from Hjelmdall's sodalite-blue eyes fill with indescribable fury. "For the Northlands!" he cries, rushing headlong into a desperate *mêlée*...
You: You gotta be kidding me...
You: Cut 'em up, Hjelmdallermann!
Variable["inventory.hjelm_perception_font"]
Variable["inventory.hjelm_perception_font"]
!(Variable["inventory.hjelm_perception_font"])
Logic: A brazen attempt to bilk fans for more money by splicing together old stories under a new title.
Jump to: [hjelmbookhub]

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: An excellent question. One easily answered by purchasing the next thrilling chapter in the Hjelmdallerman saga: 'Hjelmdallermann at the Gates of Tomorrow.' The last page of this one merely reads: 'To be continued...'
Variable["inventory.hjelm_logic_reusing_material"]
You: No, you're right, let's give this a chance. (Keep reading.)
Jump to: [Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: "You skip past a section detailing a..."]
You: Well, yeah, who else would it be?

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: In an instant the Nachtherrer summon a horde of gibbering orkenoids who rush our heroes. The hall fills with the clang of blades and the screams of the dying as the floor goes slick with steaming orkenoid viscera...
Conceptualization: Oh, for fuck's sake...
Conceptualization: Naked women and giant swords -- is that really the best they could come up with? Feels formulaic and... derivative.
Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: Enough! You're ruining the pacing of the story. Now where did you leave off? Ah, yes...
Variable["inventory.hjelm_concept_inside"]
Jump to: [Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: "The Man from Hjelmdall stares at yo..."]
Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: You know the story by heart at this point. Nothing new or remarkable catches your eye.
Jump to: [hjelmbookhub]

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: Because the flame of justice burns bright within his chest. Because above all he's driven to bring honour to the name of his beloved Hjelmdall. Because his noble Katlan blood lusts for glory and conquest. It cannot be denied.
You: Fair enough. Let's get back in there.
You: Is that all?
Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: What are you? A book critic?
Conceptualization: What better place to escape than past?
Jump to: [hjelmbookhub]
You: The publishers must have a dim view of their readership.
Logic: Their main concern is the continuation of the franchise, not making literary history.
Variable["inventory.hjelm_logic_reusing_material"]
Variable["inventory.hjelm_logic_reusing_material"]
!(Variable["inventory.hjelm_logic_reusing_material"])
You: Where there's a demand, there's always the supply. Nothing wrong with that.
You: That's enough of Man from Hjelmdall for me. (Close the book.)
Variable["inventory.hjelm_logic_reusing_material"]
!(Variable["inventory.hjelm_logic_reusing_material"])
Logic: Considering the sheer amount of different Hjelmdallermann books out there it's very unlikely you're ever gonna find the sequel.

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: Behind him rise the harsh snowcapped peaks of his native Northlands. In bold, red letters, the title "Hjelmdallermann: The Man from Hjelmdall" unfurls like a banner. In the foreground, a nearly nude woman lies spread in supplication, her privates strategically covered by her flowing black hair.

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: Behind him rise the harsh snowcapped peaks of his native Northlands. In bold, red letters, the title "Hjelmdallermann: The Man from Hjelmdall" unfurls like a banner. In the foreground, a nearly nude woman lies spread in supplication, her privates strategically covered by her flowing black hair.
You: Whoa. I did *not* see that coming!
Variable["whirling.dreamone_apes"]
Variable["whirling.dreamone_apes"]
!(Variable["whirling.dreamone_apes"])
Half Light: These images speak to something burbling deep within you: Quick! Find someone or something that needs to be gutted, beheaded, impaled on a spike!
Variable["inventory.hjelm_physint_muscle"]
Variable["inventory.hjelm_physint_muscle"]
!(Variable["inventory.hjelm_physint_muscle"])
Conceptualization: The point is: Why should you *care* about this character? Does he have any inner conflicts? Unspoken motivations? A tragic flaw, perhaps?

Perception (Sight): Below, in smaller font, you see the parenthetical: "(Adapted from: 'Man from Hjelmdall and the Necromancer's Treasure,' 'Man from Hjelmdall: Lord of Wrôthgär,' and 'Man from Hjelmdall: The Curse of Nachtherrer.')"

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: He probably is, but you can't be sure, cause this one ends in a cliffhanger and a footnote, saying: To be continued in 'Hjelmdallermann at the Gates of Tomorrow'. Coming soon to your local bookstore.
Variable["inventory.hjelm_logic_reusing_material"]
Variable["inventory.hjelm_logic_reusing_material"]
!(Variable["inventory.hjelm_logic_reusing_material"])
You: Read the first couple of pages.
You: [Put the book away.]
You: Nevermind. (Keep reading.)
You: Why is he doing all of this?
Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: As the vile ceremony ends, the sound of steel unsheathing draws the Nachtherrers' attention to a pair of cloaked figures standing in the doorway...
Jump to: [Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: "The Man from Hjelmdall stares at yo..."]
Variable["doomed.bookstore_hjelmdallerman_halfligt_muscle_and_fury"]
!(Variable["doomed.bookstore_hjelmdallerman_halfligt_muscle_and_fury"])
Half Light: No, beautiful naked people fucking in the bushes is what you came for. Sweat, cocks and and titties please!
Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: Swiftly the visitors toss off their cloaks and unsheathe glimmering northern steel -- it's the Man from Hjelmdall and his valiant blood-brother Tyrbald!
Variable["XP.hjelmdallerman_suffered_through_the_whole_book"]
Conceptualization: What pacing?!
Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: What?
You: This is almost exactly the same as the first scene! Even the word *gibbering* is used twice.
Variable["inventory.hjelm_firsthub_reached"]
!(Variable["inventory.hjelm_firsthub_reached"])

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: ... and with deadly finesse his twin blades scissor the necromancer's head from its body. The undead legions collapse like rag dolls as the dark magic leaves them and the two northmen stand alone in the accursed temple, where the bodies of their lost brothers litter the floors.
You: I've read enough. (Close the book.)
You: Is there anything else to his character?

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: The Man from Hjelmdall extracts a high price from the desperate king. He asks land for the homeless desert-pygmies living exiled in the kingdom's borderlands. Wrôthgär offers the hand of his eldest daughter instead, but the son of winter does not budge...
Electrochemistry: Oh! This seems interesting...

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: The northmen find themselves in the court of a powerful southern king -- *Lord Wrôthgär*. The old king beseeches the Man from Hjelmdall to rid his kingdom of the *Nachtherrer*, a subterranean clan of blind wizards who traded their souls for demonic powers.
You: Actually yes, I'm a *goddamn* art cop.
You: I might be.

Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: The story opens *in media res*. The Man from Hjelmdall and his band of northern *reavers* are in the bowels of an ancient temple, surrounded by an army of gibbering *wights* led by the deathless *necromancer*. One by one the brave northmen fall to the relentless crush of undead, only to join their number as reanimated corpses...
Logic: People find comfort in familiarity, remembering old experiences, looking at old photos, reading old stories.
Variable["inventory.hjelm_concept_inside"]
!(Variable["inventory.hjelm_concept_inside"])
Hjelmdallermann: the Man from Hjelmdall: What do you mean 'is that all'?
Variable["XP.hjelmdallerman_suffered_through_the_whole_book"]
!(Variable["XP.hjelmdallerman_suffered_through_the_whole_book"])
